main event: A witness spotted a round, white object in the sky near Honor, Michigan on March 1, 1967.
interesting points: The object was stationary and varied in color as it moved.
The witness used binoculars to observe the object, which was visible for about 30 minutes.
The weather forecaster at the local air division said there was a surface inversion at the time, which was likely the cause of the sighting.
The Air Force determined that there were no aircraft, balloons, or other known objects in the area that could explain the sighting.
The witness, who ran a hardware store in Honor, Michigan, was deemed to be of reliable character.
sighted object: a round, white object in the sky
witnesses: a witness running a hardware store
